data.name: Basic_Help
data.value:
This tool can memorize actions and execute them. Currently supports: Url Script Executable Directory
Usage: fcli <tool?> [params ...] [flags ...]
fcli add C:\Awesome --exe --name awe fcli awe
For more information about the tools use --help. To list all tools or commands use: fcli list fcli list --tool

data.name: Full_Help
data.value:
This tool can be used to remember apps, sites and script files, and call them afterwards. This should help with using command line.
Syntax: fcli <tool/command> [flags...]
Tools: Tools manipulate command storage and do informational work.
add - stores new command to storage. remove - deletes a known command from storage. list - displays all known commands or tools. run - performs a command without saving it. config - alters user configuration. group - creates command execution sequences. change - alters existing command.
More detailed info about each command can be access by specifying special flag --help after that specific tool.
Commands: If given argument doesn't align with a known tool or it's alias it is considered a command. If this command is known, then it gets executed in the most appropriate vay. All known commands can be listed using list tool.
Usage: fcli add c:\awesome --exe -name aw fcli aw --options "-s 2" fcli remove aw fcli add https://google.com --name google fcli google

data.name: FCli_MultipleArgs
data.value: FCli accepts only [tool?] arg, but more then one arg was found.

data.value: Flag (--{0}) shouldn't have any value. To see list of all supported flags for {1} tool consult help page using --help flag.

data.name: Tool_FlagIsUnknown
data.value: Flag (--{0}) is not a known flag for the {1} tool. To see list of all supported flags for {2} tool consult help page using --help flag.

data.value: ({0}) - is not a valid url.

data.name: Tool_PathIsInvalid
data.value: ({0}) - is not a valid system path.

data.name: Add_Help
data.value: Add - validates a new command and adds it to the storage. Requires a valid path or url as an argument. Flags: --script <shell> - the path points to the script file. --exe - the path points to the executable. --url - the argument is a url. --dir - the path points to a directory. --name <value> - explicitly specify the name for the command. --options <args> - options to run exe or script with. --help - show description. Usage: fcli add c:/awesome.exe fcli add .\scripts\script --script bash --name sc

data.name: Add_FileUnrecognized
data.value: Couldn't recognize the type of file. Please, specify it using type flags. To see the list of type flags use --help.

data.name: Add_BashOnWindows
data.value: Command ({0}) is interpreted as a bash script, but Windows operating system is currently running. Bash scripts can be executed on Windows, FCli uses WSL for that. You need to make sure that your system has WSL installed and default distro enabled.

data.name: Add_FishOnWindows
data.value: Command ({0}) is interpreted as a Fish script, but Windows operating system is currently running. Fish is only supported on Unix-like operating systems.

data.name: Add_CmdOnLinux
data.value: Command ({0}) is interpreted as a batch file, but Linux operating system is running. CMD is only supported on Windows.

data.name: Add_PowershellOnLinux
data.value: Command ({0}) is interpreted as a powershell script, but Linux operating system is running. PS scripts can be executed on Linux, but powershell needs to be installed from the packet manager.

data.name: Add_OSScript_Question
data.value: Can your machine run this type of script?

data.name: Add_ParsedCommand
Config_Help
data.value: Config tool allows to manipulate current user config. Using this you can change some values store or purge config. List current config state if nothing is specified. Flags: --locale <loc> - sets culture locale for the tool. Supported locales: en, ru, uk. --formatter <type> - sets console formatter to use for messaging. - inline - displays most messages as a single line. - pretty - more verbose and uses multiline templates. --purge - deletes current config. --help - displays help page. Usage: fcli config fcli cnf --locale en --formatter pretty fcli config --purge

data.name: Config_ListConfig
data.value: No flags given, listing current config:

data.name: Config_Purged
data.value: Config purged.

data.name: List_Help
data.value: List - echos existing commands to the console based on the selection given by flags. If no flags given - lists all existing commands. Arg is used as filter for this tool. Flags: Commands: --script - adds scripts to listing. --exe - adds executables to listing. --url - adds urls to listing. --dir - adds directories to listing. Special: --tools - lists available tool selectors. --shells - lists supported shell types. --types - lists known command types. --groups - adds groups to listing. --help - show description. Usage: fcli list fcli list --tools fcli ls --script --url

data.name: List_NoCommands
data.value: There are no known commands.

data.name: List_ListAllCommands
data.value: No flags given, listing all commands:

data.name: Remove_Help
data.value: Remove - deletes command from storage. Flags: --yes - skip confirmation. --all - removes all known commands. --help - show description. Usage: fcli remove awesome --yes

data.name: Remove_AllWarning
data.value: All flag: preparing to delete all known commands.

data.name: Remove_NoCommands
data.value: There are no commands to delete!

data.name: Remove_AllDeleted
data.value: All existing commands have been deleted.

data.name: Remove_Warning
data.value: Preparing to delete {0} command.

data.name: Remove_Deleted
data.value: Command ({0}) was successfully deleted.

data.name: Run_Help
data.value: Run - executes given path or url without saving. Useful for testing. Requires path or url, as well as explicit specification of run type through a flag. Flags: --script <shell> - run as script. --exe - run as executable. --url - run as url. --dir - run as dir. --help - show description. Usage: fcli run c:/awesome --script powershell fcli run https://awesome.com --url

data.name: Run_UnknownCommand
data.value: Command type wasn't recognized. Please specify it using a type flag. To see Run syntax and available type flags use --help.

data.name: Command_UnsupportedShell
data.value: ({0}) cannot be run on ({1}) systems!

data.name: Command_UnsupportedShellWarning
data.value: Attempting to execute ({0}) on ({1})...

data.name: Group_Help
data.value: Group tool can associate known commands into executable sequence. In this way, you can specify collections on commands that all will be executed. To create a group, you need to list all commands you want executed separated by spaces and in quotes. (--name) flag is mandatory. This tool also manipulates groups via flags. Flags: --name <name> - creates a new group with this name. --remove - deletes specified command (arg is a group name). --all - in conjunction with remove deletes all groups. --override <name> - changes group of the specified name. --yes - skips confirmations. --help - displays help page. Usage: fcli group "cmd1 cmd2" --name mygr fcli gr "cmd1 cmd2 cmd3" --override mygr --yes fcli group mygr --remove

data.name: Group_Constructed
Group_OverrideWarning
data.value: You are about to override group ({0}) with given sequence.

data.name: Group_RemoveAllWarning
data.value: All flag: you are about to delete all existing command groups.

data.name: Group_RemovedAll
data.value: All groups were removed from storage.

data.name: Group_NoGroups
data.value: There are no groups to remove!

data.name: Group_Removed
data.value: Group ({0}) was deleted.

data.name: Group_NotAGroup
data.value: ({0}) is not a group!

data.name: Change_Help
data.value: Change - enables altering of existing commands. Argument is always a command name and new values are provided using flags. To change group sequence use group tool. Attention!!! This tool will allow you to change types and names - that may break command execution or associated groups. Also it doesn't perform validation on path. Use these options with care. Flags: --name - new command name. --path - new path. --type - new command type. --shell - new shell type. --options - new command line options. --help - displays this page. Usage: fcli change awesome --name newName --type script --shell bash fcli ch newName --type exe --path /new/path

data.name: Change_NameWarning
Change_PathWarning
Change_TypeWarning
Change_ShellWarning
Change_OptionsWarning
